title: How to Make a Blue Jeans Cake

steps.headline: Prepare your frosting bowls.
steps.description: Add about 2/3 to 5/6 of the frosting and 2-3 drops of blue food coloring to one bowl and 1/6 to 1/3 of the frosting and 1-2 drops of yellow food coloring to another bowl. Mix thoroughly to get the desired color pigment you want for the jeans.

steps.headline: Using a serrated knife, carefully slice off the "dome" or top of the cake.
steps.description: Doing this makes the cake flat. Turn the cake upside down and place it vertical in height.

steps.headline: Cut off about an inch (2.5cm) of the side.
steps.description: This will become the "belt" of the cake.

steps.headline: Prepare your cake shape.
steps.description:
You can use a pre-made template or eyeball it. Place a toothpick about 2 inches (5cm) in the center from the top and 2 toothpicks on the bottom, 2 inches (5cm) from each side. Cut in a triangular form, using the toothpicks as guides. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/45\/Blue_Jeans_Cake05_752.png\/460px-Blue_Jeans_Cake05_752.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/45\/Blue_Jeans_Cake05_752.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":247,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":407.6363636363636,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.5min.com\/Video\/How-to-Make-a-Blue-Jeans-Cake-516946749<\/a> - Shared with permission from 5min.com\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Cut a symmetrical triangle inside the triangle wedge. These two pieces will be used to extend the bottom hems of the jeans.

steps.headline: Put the pieces together.
steps.description: Trim off the belt to the size of the cake length.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d8\/Blue_Jeans_Cake08_999.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d8\/Blue_Jeans_Cake08_999.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":389,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":642.2,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.5min.com\/Video\/How-to-Make-a-Blue-Jeans-Cake-516946749<\/a> - Shared with permission from 5min.com\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Use some of the frosting as an adhesive "glue" to attach all of the pieces to the cake.
steps.description: Cover and frost the cake evenly with half of the blue frosting. Place in the refrigerator for the frosting to harden.

steps.headline: Use the remaining blue frosting to create another even layer.
Pipe the yellow frosting into a tube.
steps.description: If you don't have one, you can use a sandwich baggie and make a very small hole at the bottom. Dab small indents on the cake to create pocket outlines, the zipper, and bottom hems.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/fc\/Blue_Jeans_Cake12_746.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/fc\/Blue_Jeans_Cake12_746.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":280,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":462.90909090909093,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.5min.com\/Video\/How-to-Make-a-Blue-Jeans-Cake-516946749<\/a> - Shared with permission from 5min.com\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Use a fruit roll-up as the customized belt buckle.
steps.description: Tear 2 thin slices of roll-up and make tassels. Dab on yellow frosting along the buckle and lay M&Ms on top to create a stud style.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/a0\/Blue_Jeans_Cake13_527.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/a0\/Blue_Jeans_Cake13_527.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":408,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":673.6363636363636,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.5min.com\/Video\/How-to-Make-a-Blue-Jeans-Cake-516946749<\/a> - Shared with permission from 5min.com\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Accessorize the rest of the jeans. Place a piece of fruit roll-up by the knee to create a patch and outline it with yellow frosting dots. Make up your own designs relying on your imagination.

text:
Prepare your frosting bowls. Add about 2/3 to 5/6 of the frosting and 2-3 drops of blue food coloring to one bowl and 1/6 to 1/3 of the frosting and 1-2 drops of yellow food coloring to another bowl. Mix thoroughly to get the desired color pigment you want for the jeans. Using a serrated knife, carefully slice off the "dome" or top of the cake. Doing this makes the cake flat. Turn the cake upside down and place it vertical in height. Cut off about an inch (2.5cm) of the side. This will become the "belt" of the cake. Prepare your cake shape. You can use a pre-made template or eyeball it. Place a toothpick about 2 inches (5cm) in the center from the top and 2 toothpicks on the bottom, 2 inches (5cm) from each side. Cut in a triangular form, using the toothpicks as guides. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/45/Blue_Jeans_Cake05_752.png/460px-Blue_Jeans_Cake05_752.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/45/Blue_Jeans_Cake05_752.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":247,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":407.6363636363636,"licensing":"

http://www.5min.com/Video/How-to-Make-a-Blue-Jeans-Cake-516946749 - Shared with permission from 5min.com

License: Creative Commons

"}Cut a symmetrical triangle inside the triangle wedge. These two pieces will be used to extend the bottom hems of the jeans. Put the pieces together. Trim off the belt to the size of the cake length. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/d/d8/Blue_Jeans_Cake08_999.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/d/d8/Blue_Jeans_Cake08_999.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":389,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":642.2,"licensing":"

http://www.5min.com/Video/How-to-Make-a-Blue-Jeans-Cake-516946749 - Shared with permission from 5min.com

License: Creative Commons

"}Use some of the frosting as an adhesive "glue" to attach all of the pieces to the cake. Cover and frost the cake evenly with half of the blue frosting. Place in the refrigerator for the frosting to harden. Use the remaining blue frosting to create another even layer. Pipe the yellow frosting into a tube. If you don't have one, you can use a sandwich baggie and make a very small hole at the bottom. Dab small indents on the cake to create pocket outlines, the zipper, and bottom hems. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/fc/Blue_Jeans_Cake12_746.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/fc/Blue_Jeans_Cake12_746.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":280,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":462.90909090909093,"licensing":"

http://www.5min.com/Video/How-to-Make-a-Blue-Jeans-Cake-516946749 - Shared with permission from 5min.com

License: Creative Commons

"}Use a fruit roll-up as the customized belt buckle. Tear 2 thin slices of roll-up and make tassels. Dab on yellow frosting along the buckle and lay M&Ms on top to create a stud style. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/a0/Blue_Jeans_Cake13_527.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/a0/Blue_Jeans_Cake13_527.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":408,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":673.6363636363636,"licensing":"

http://www.5min.com/Video/How-to-Make-a-Blue-Jeans-Cake-516946749 - Shared with permission from 5min.com

License: Creative Commons

"} Accessorize the rest of the jeans. Place a piece of fruit roll-up by the knee to create a patch and outline it with yellow frosting dots. Make up your own designs relying on your imagination.
